basics.name: Qasim Ali
basics.label: Research Engineer
basics.summary: Graduate student in AI and Robotics

work.name: Magna Electronics
work.summary: Contributed to embedded software development for advanced self-driving features.
highlights: Debugged complex detection algorithms and state machines in simulation and real-time.
Developed communication interfaces for vehicle signal integration.
Implemented end-to-end AWS pipeline for cloud-based KPI tracking.
Built a tool using Unreal Engine for visualizing object and lane detection.

publications.name: Humanoid World Models: Open World Foundation Models for Humanoid Robotics
publications.publisher: ICML 2025 Workshop on Building Physically-Plausible World Models
publications.summary: Trained video-based world models for humanoid robotics using diffusion, flow matching, and masked transformers. Used parameter reduction strategies to reduce model size.

publications.name: GraphPad: Inference-Time 3D Scene Graph Updates for Embodied Question Answering
publications.publisher: CVPR 2025 Workshop on  Bridging Language, Vision and Action in 3D Environments
publications.summary: Proposed a scene graph and API-based reasoning pipeline that improved EQA benchmarks using fewer images.

publications.name: MR-CRL: Leveraging Predictive Representations for Contrastive Goal-Conditioned Reinforcement
publications.publisher: RLC 2025 Workshop on Reinforcement Learning Beyond Rewards
publications.summary: Developed a predictive representation algorithm for goal-conditioned reinforcement learning in maze and manipulation tasks.

publications.name: MGSO: Monocular Real-time Photometric SLAM with Efficient 3D Gaussian Splatting
publications.summary:
Helped develop a real-time 3D reconstruction algorithm using Gaussian Splatting and DSO SLAM. Team achieved state of the art visual quality and FPS. 
 Note: I was not the lead author on this paper, but contributed to the gaussian splatting improvements.

publications.name: RepViT-MedSAM: Efficient Segment Anything in the Medical Images
publications.publisher: Springer, Cham (Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 15458)
publications.summary: RepViT-MedSAM proposes an efficient, distilled alternative to MedSAM for medical image segmentation, achieving strong Dice and NSD scores while reducing computational cost. Designed as part of a Medical Imaging contest.

projects.name: Parking Lot Drone
projects.summary: Autonomous drone system for detecting parking occupancy. Developed as undergrad capstone project.

projects.name: Autonomous Vehicle Control
projects.summary: Designed autonomous control logic for V2I intersections as part of McMaster EcoCar team.
